item.title: Efficient Multi-Hop Question Answering over Knowledge Graphs via LLM Planning and Embedding-Guided Search
item.description: arXiv:2511.19648v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Multi-hop question answering over knowledge graphs remains computationally challenging due to the combinatorial explosion of possible reasoning paths. Recent approaches rely on expensive Large Language Model (LLM) inference for both entity linking and...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> LLM, reasoning, large language model, arxiv, embedding | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Gender Bias in Emotion Recognition by Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2511.19785v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The rapid advancement of large language models (LLMs) and their growing integration into daily life underscore the importance of evaluating and ensuring their fairness. In this work, we examine fairness within the domain of emotional theory of mind, i...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> LLM, large language model, prompt, arxiv, prompt engineering | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: PrefixGPT: Prefix Adder Optimization by a Generative Pre-trained Transformer
item.description: arXiv:2511.19472v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Prefix adders are widely used in compute-intensive applications for their high speed. However, designing optimized prefix adders is challenging due to strict design rules and an exponentially large design space. We introduce PrefixGPT, a generative pr...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> RAG, product, arxiv, model, transformer | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
